definition: to burn/to ignite/to light/fig. to spark off (hopes)/to start (debate)/to raise (hopes)
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
fuel gas (coal gas, natural gas, methane etc)
to ignite/to light/fig. to spark off (hopes, controversy, flames of revolution)
lit. the fire burns one's eyebrows (idiom); fig. desperate situation/extreme emergency
lit. ashes burn once more (idiom); fig. sb lost returns to have influence/sth malevolent returns to haunt one

sentences.english: Candle of the heart promising is only a comfort.
sentences.chinese: 燃一盞心燈，燭光下，明知道許願只是一種安慰。

sentences.english: Afterburner system is runing very smoothly.
sentences.chinese: 後燃加力系統運行平緩。

sentences.english: Some carburetors have an auxiliary fuel valve and inlet.
sentences.chinese: 有些化油器具有備用的燃油閥和入口。

sentences.english: Some carburetors have an auxiliary fuel valve and inlet .
sentences.chinese: 有些化油器具有備用的燃油閥和入口。

sentences.english: The wind ceased, the torch was lighted once more.
sentences.chinese: 風停息了，火炬又燃了起來。

sentences.english: Remember, if gas is turned off, a  professional must restore service.
sentences.chinese: 在燃氣閘關閉後，必須由專業人員重新打開。

sentences.english: Halperin also claims that Jennifer Aniston is keen to rekindle her romance with Pitt.
sentences.chinese: 哈普林還聲稱詹妮弗安妮斯頓想和皮特重燃愛火。

sentences.english: I suspect that ironing board covers and oven mitts are pretty much the same heat-retardant material.
sentences.chinese: 和微波爐手套是非常相似的熱阻燃材料。

sentences.english: They shall be set upon the most pure candlestick before the Lord continually.
sentences.chinese: 亞郎應把這些燈放在純金臺上，在上主面前長燃不熄。

definition: to ignite/to light/fig. to spark off (hopes, controversy, flames of revolution)
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
to stop burning/to go out (of fire)/to die out/extinguished
ardent/intense/fierce/stern/upright/to give one's life for a noble cause/exploits/achievements
to cause to explode/to fire/to set off
to burn/to cook/to stew/to bake/to roast/to heat/to boil (tea, water etc)/fever/to run a temperature/(coll.) to let things go to one's head
to soar/to gallop/to prance/to turn over/to vacate/to clear
